text: In the name of Allah, the Most Gracious, the Most Merciful. The First Treatise. Praise be to Allah, and peace and blessings be upon the Messenger of Allah, his family, his companions, and those who follow his guidance. To proceed: The Kuwaiti newspaper 'Al-Mujtama' published in its issue No. 15, dated 19/4/1395 AH, verses under the title (In Memory of the Noble Prophet's Birthday) containing supplications for relief to the Prophet (peace be upon him) and seeking victory through him to save the Ummah (nation), grant it victory, and save it from the division and discord it has fallen into. It was signed by someone calling herself 'Amina'. This is the text of the verses referred to: 'O Messenger of Allah, save a world... that ignites war and burns in its flames. O Messenger of Allah, save a nation... that has walked long in the darkness of doubt. O Messenger of Allah, save a nation... whose visions have been lost in the mazes of sorrow.'

Allah commanded His Prophet (peace be upon him) to inform people that his prayer and his rites - which means slaughtering - and his life and death are for Allah, the Lord of the worlds, with no partner. So whoever slaughters for other than Allah has associated partners with Allah, just as if he prayed to other than Allah, because Allah Glory be to Him made prayer and slaughtering companions, and informed that they are for Allah alone with no partner. So whoever slaughters for other than Allah, such as Jinn, Angels, the dead, and others, seeking to draw near to them thereby, is like one who prays to other than Allah. [Shirk deserving entry into the Fire which intercession cannot reach] In the authentic Hadith, the Prophet (peace be upon him) says: "May Allah curse the one who slaughters for other than Allah." Imam Ahmad narrated with a good chain of transmission from Tariq bin Shihab, may Allah be pleased with him, from the Prophet (peace be upon him) that he said: "Two men passed by a people who had an idol which no one could pass until he offered something to it. They said to one of them: 'Offer something.' He said: 'I have nothing to offer.' They said: 'Offer even a fly.' So he offered a fly, and they let him pass, so he entered the Fire.

text: They said to the other: 'Offer something.' He said: 'I would not offer anything to anyone other than Allah Almighty.' So they struck his neck (beheaded him), and he entered Paradise."
